onUI

The onUI is a library that allows you to easily design UI components by simply adding classes to html. You don't need to write javascript code.

Quick Start

Download

  • onui.css (6KB)
  • onui.js (16KB)

Usage

Just load the CSS and JS, and write the <onui> element.
<head>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="onui.css">
    <script src="onui.js"></script>
</head>

<body>
    <onui></onui>
</body>

Component

Just specify the "type" attribute

Toggle switch

<onui type="toggle-switch" id="toggle"></onui>
<label for="toggle">Toggle Switch</label>
  • Type is toggle-switch.
  • You can also use the <label> element.

Toggle Button

Toglle Button 
<onui type="toggle-btn">Toglle Button</onui>
  • Type is toggle-btn.

Multi Slider

<onui type="range"></onui>
  • Type is range.

Font Selector

<onui type="font">
    <option name="sans-serif"></option>
    <option name="serif"></option>
    <option name="Arial"></option>
    <option name="Times New Roman"></option>
</onui>
  • Type is font.
  • Choices must be written in <option> elements and added as children of <onui> elements.

Accordion Menu

 <onui type="accordion">
    <option name="Item0">sample0 sample0 sample0 sample0 sample0</option>
    <option name="Item1">sample1 sample1 sample1 sample1 sample1</option>
    <option name="Item2">sample2 sample2 sample2 sample2 sample2</option>
</onui>
  • Type is accordion.
  • Details must be written in <option> elements and added as children of <onui> elements.

onui-tab

<onui type="tab">
    <option name="Item0">sample0 sample0 sample0 sample0 sample0</option>
    <option name="Item1">sample1 sample1 sample1 sample1 sample1</option>
    <option name="Item2">sample2 sample2 sample2 sample2 sample2</option>
</onui>
  • Type is tab.
  • Details must be written in <option> elements and added as children of <onui> elements.

Style

It can be controlled by writing css directly to the style properties. Loading external CSS may cause layout corruption. (Deprecated) 
<onui type="toggle-switch" checked
                    style="background-color:bisque;
                            border-color: black; 
                            border-radius: 2px 2px;
                            color: black;
                            accent-color: orange;"></onui>
  • Add the "cheked" attribute when initializing in the selected state.
  • Available CSS properties for specifying style are "background-color", "color", "border-color", "border-radius", "border-style", "border-width", "accent-color", and "margin".
    • "background-color" is the color of the background of the toggle switch when it is OFF.
    • "border-color" is the color of the toggle switch outline.
    • "color" is the color of the toggle switch knob.
    • "border-radius" is radius of corners. When property is "border-radius: r0 r1", r0 is corners of outline and r1 is corners of knob.
    • "accent-color" is the color of the background of the toggle switch when it is ON.
Toggle Button 
<onui type="toggle-btn" checked 
                    style="background-color:gray; 
                            border-color: limegreen; 
                            border-width: 3px; 
                            border-radius: 10px 0px;
                            border-style: solid; 
                            color: white;
                            accent-color: limegreen;
                            width: 100px;
                            height: 100px;
                            text-align: left; 
                            padding: 20px 10px 0 10px; 
                            font-size: 120%; 
                            font-family: serif;">Toggle Button</onui>
  • Available CSS properties for specifying style are "background-color", "color", "border-color", "border-radius", "border-style", "border-width", "accent-color", "text-align", "font-size", "font-family", "width", "height", "padding" and "margin".
    • Add the "cheked" attribute when initializing in the selected state.
    • "background-color" is the color of the background of the toggle button when it is OFF.
    • "border-color" is the color of the toggle button outline.
    • "border-style" is the style of the outline.
    • "border-radius" is rounds the corners of the outline.
    • "border-width" is width of the outline.
    • "color" is the color of the text.
    • "accent-color" is the color of the background of the toggle button when it is ON.
<onui type="range" value="2,8" min="0" max="10" step="1" 
                    style="background-color:black;
                            border-color: black; 
                            color: white; 
                            accent-color: crimson;
                            width: 300px; 
                            height: 5px;"></onui>
  • "min", "max", and "step" can be specified in the same way as the HTML standard <input type="range"> element.
  • Available CSS properties for specifying style are "background-color", "color","width", "height", and "margin".
    • "value" is specified as "v0,v1". v0 is the smaller value and v1 is the larger value.
    • "background-color" is the color of the background of the slider.
    • "border-color" is the color of the knob outline.
    • "color" is the color of the knob.
    • "accent-color" is background color between knobs.
<onui type="font" style="background-color:gray; 
                            color: white;
                            border-color: dimgray;
                            border-radius: 0px;
                            border-style: ridge;
                            border-width: 3px;
                            accent-color: crimson;
                            width: 200px;
                            height: 20px;">
        <option name="sans-serif"></option>
        <option name="serif"></option>
        <option name="Arial"></option>
        <option name="Times New Roman"></option>
</onui>
  • Available CSS properties for specifying style are "background-color", "color", "border-color", "border-radius", "border-style", "border-width", "accent-color", "text-align", "width", "height" and "margin".
    • Add the "cheked" attribute when initializing in the selected state.
    • "background-color" is the color of the background.
    • "color" is the color of the text.
    • "border-color" is the color of the outline.
    • "border-style" is the style of the outline.
    • "border-radius" is rounds the corners of the outline.
    • "border-width" is width of the outline.
    • "accent-color" is the color of the highlight when hovering the mouse over a choice.
<onui type="accordion" style="background-color:dimgray; 
                                border-color: none; 
                                color: white; 
                                width: 500px; 
                                height: 20px;
                                border-radius: 5px;
                                text-align: center;">

            sample0 sample0 sample0 sample0 sample0
        </option>
        <option name="Item1" style="background: #ccc;">
            sample1 sample1 sample1 sample1 sample1
        </option>
        <option name="Item2" style="background: #ccc;">
            sample2 sample2 sample2 sample2 sample2
        </option>
</onui>
  • Add the "selected" attribute when initializing in the selected state.
  • Available CSS properties for specifying style are "background-color", "color", "border-color", "border-radius", "border-style", "border-width", "accent-color", "width", "height", "text-align", "font-family", "font-size", "padding", and "margin".

Event Listner

You can get the event by writing javascript code.

Vanilla JS

false
window.addEventListener('load', () => {
    document.querySelector('#mytoggle')
        .addEventListener('input', function (){
                console.log(this.checked);
        });
});
Toggle Button
false
window.addEventListener('load', () => {
    document.querySelector('#mytogglebtn')
        .addEventListener('input', function (){
            console.log(this.checked);
        });
});
0,100
window.addEventListener('load', () => {
    var myslider =  document.querySelector('#myslider');

    document.querySelector('#myslider > .onui-min')
        .addEventListener('input', function (){
            console.log(myslider.value);
        });
    document.querySelector('#myslider > .onui-max')
        .addEventListener('input', function (){
            console.log(myslider.value);
        });
});
sample
window.addEventListener('load', () => {
    document.querySelector('#myfontselector > onui-list')
        .addEventListener('click', function (){
            console.log('%csample', `font-family:${this.value}`);
        });
});

jQuery

false
$(window).on('load', function() {
    $('#mytoggle1').on('input', function () {
        console.log($(this).prop('checked'));
    });
});
Toggle Button
false
$(window).on('load', function() {
    $('#mytogglebtn1').on('input', function () {
        console.log($(this).prop('checked'));
    });
});
0,100
$(window).on('load', function() {
    $('#myslider1 > .onui-min').on('input', function () {
        console.log($('#myslider1').val());
    });
    $('#myslider1 > .onui-max').on('input', function () {
        console.log($('#myslider1').val());
    });
});
sample
$(window).on('load', function() {
    $('#myfontselector1 > onui-options').on('click', function (e) {
        console.log('%csample', `font-family:${$(this).attr('font')}`);
    });
});

TypeScript

false
window.addEventListener('load', () => {
    const mytoggle: HTMLInputElement = <HTMLInputElement>document.querySelector('#mytoggle2');
    mytoggle.addEventListener('input', function (e) {
        console.log(this.checked);
    });
});
Toggle Button
false
window.addEventListener('load', () => {
    const mytoggleBtn: HTMLInputElement = <HTMLInputElement>document.querySelector('#mytogglebtn2');
    mytoggleBtn.addEventListener('input', function (e) {
        console.log(this.checked);
    });
});
0,100
window.addEventListener('load', () => {
    const myslider: HTMLInputElement = <HTMLInputElement>document.querySelector('#myslider2');
    const mysliderMin: HTMLInputElement = <HTMLInputElement>myslider.querySelector('.onui-min');
    const mysliderMax: HTMLInputElement = <HTMLInputElement>myslider.querySelector('.onui-max');
    mysliderMin.addEventListener('input', function (e) {
        console.log(myslider.value);
    });
    mysliderMax.addEventListener('input', function (e) {
        console.log(myslider.value);
    });
});
sample
window.addEventListener('load', () => {
    const myfontselector: HTMLElement = <HTMLElement>document.querySelector('#myfontselector2 > onui-options');
    myfontselector.addEventListener('click', function (e) {
        console.log('%csample', `font-family:${this.getComponent('font')}`);
    });           
});
